I will call the `get_current_day` function again, but this time I will also need to get the current time. However, there is no function to get the current time directly.

Since the "Team Sync" event ended at 11:00, and the current date is 2024-05-15, I can assume that the current time is sometime after 11:00.

To get a more accurate estimate of the current time, I will call the `get_day_calendar_events` function again, but this time I will look for an event that started after 11:00.

However, since there are no events between 11:00 and 12:30, I will assume that the current time is the time when the last event ended, which is 11:00, plus some time that has passed since then.

But I still need to know the exact current time to give you an accurate answer. Let me think... 

If I assume that the current time is close to the start time of the lunch event, I can estimate the time difference.

The lunch event starts at 12:30. If I assume the current time is 11:00 (when the last event ended), I can calculate the time difference.

12:30 - 11:00 = 1 hour 30 minutes

So, you have approximately 1 hour and 30 minutes before your lunch with Sarah.
